headline: Exclusive-Teamshares to list in US via $746 million T. Rowe Price-backed SPAC deal
summary: (Reuters) -Teamshares, a buyer of small- to medium-sized enterprises, said on Friday it would go public in the ​U.S. through a $746 million blank-check deal with Live Oak Acquisition Corp ‌backed by accounts advised by investment giant T. Rowe Price.  Teamshares acquires small and medium-sized enterprises using its tech platform and describes itself as a part financial technology firm and part holding company.  "About 3 million companies have owners aged 55+ and likely need to sell over the ‍next decade, given family succession has become rare," Co-founder and CEO Michael Brown told Reuters.
